hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Gap Reversal After News-Driven Selloff
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC experiences a >5% intraday drop on negative macro news (US budget crisis, regulatory headlines), but aggregate exchange liquidity (bid+ask depth) remains stable or increases within 2 hours, price will mean-revert >60% of the drop within 24 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: News-driven selloffs often trigger algorithmic/retail panic selling while institutional liquidity providers maintain or increase bids. The rapid liquidity recovery indicates selling pressure exhaustion and creates a temporary dislocation.
entry_conditions: Negative macro news headline within past 4 hours (sentiment score <-0.7)
Aggregate BTC/USDT liquidity across top-5 exchanges recovers to >=95% of pre-drop levels within 2 hours of low
Price stabilizes within ±1% for 30 minutes after liquidity recovery

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price reaches 60% retracement of the initial drop
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price breaks below the intraday low by 1.5%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If >50% of such events see continued selling despite liquidity recovery (price drops another >3% after entry) over next 6 months.
